exhibition_department: Historic: Chinese, Indian, and Southeast Asian Art
exhibition_title: Ancient Gold: Jewelry from the Dallas Museum of Art
exhibition_description: The Dallas Museum of Artâ€™s collection of Mediterranean gold represents a historically wide-ranging group of ancient work from the critical periods of Greek and Etruscan jewelry making and is one of the finest such collections in the United States. 105 objects ranging from exotic Etruscan fibula and earrings to a Greek olive wreath and medallions and a representation of Roman gold work, including a dramatic snake armlet, were featured. The selection allows the viewer to understand the stylistic development during the 1,000 year period from the 7th-century BC to the 3rd-century AD and the importance of gold and the display of wealth was to these three cultures.
